main_definition: To store or save data temporarily in a location where it can be quickly accessed when needed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, to store data that has been retrieved from the internet for faster access later on
meanings_and_examples.example: When I download a large file over the internet and then cache it in my browser, I can quickly open it again without having to download it again.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To keep information readily available for easy retrieval or use
meanings_and_examples.example: The website uses caching techniques so that when you visit a page frequently, the content is stored and loaded faster each time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports, to store an object in anticipation of using it again
meanings_and_examples.example: The basketball player cached his hands under the hoop while waiting for the ball to come over.
